content:
Analyze how Donald Trump could potentially consolidate enough power in his current term 2025-2029 to mirror [Vladimir Putin's constitutional changes](https://www.journalofdemocracy.org/articles/russias-road-to-autocracy/) allowing him to be a dictator for life. Consider [historical precedents](https://www.britannica.com/topic/authoritarianism) step-by-step comparing to Trumps [Project 2025](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_2025) his [grip on federal judges](https://foreignpolicy.com/2025/03/26/trump-judiciary-courts-constitutional-crisis-executive/) and his [grip on the republican party](https://www.axios.com/2025/03/20/trump-support-republican-concerns-silent). Focus on constitutional mechanisms and social influencing and propaganda rather than violence or force. Consider:

1. Constitutional amendments and legal frameworks
2. Control of key institutions
3. Media and information control
4. Economic leverage
5. Political party consolidation

Use specific examples from both Russian and historical contexts to illustrate each point. Maintain an analytical, non-partisan tone.
